TEXT: CARDINAL . The first applicant was born in DATE and lives in ORG . The second applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the first applicant graduated from ORG , qualifying as a certified sports instructor .

On CARDINAL DATE ORG and ORG into the Genocide and Resistance of the NORP People jointly concluded that from DATE the second applicant had been an employee of the NORP branch of the ORG , that he had the status of a “ former ORG officer ” and that he was thereby subject to the restrictions provided under LAW . CARDINAL . Following an appeal by the security intelligence authorities , on DATE ORG quashed the judgment of DATE . It held that , although the first - instance court had properly found that the second applicant had worked at the ORG for DATE , it had not been established that he had worked there as a secret informer for the NORP authorities . Accordingly , he could not benefit from the exceptions under LAW .

CARDINAL . The second applicant appealed against ORG judgment . By a decision of DATE , the President of ORG allowed the appeal . However , by a final decision of DATE , the full ORG refused to examine the appeal and discontinued the proceedings for lack of jurisdiction .

The KGB Act reads as follows :

“ ORG ( ORG , ORG , ORG , ORG – hereinafter ‘ the SSC’ ) is recognised as a criminal organisation which was responsible for war crimes , genocide , repression , terror and political persecution in the territory of GPE when occupied by the GPE . ”

“ For DATE from the date of entry into force of this LAW , former employees of the ORG may not work as public officials or civil servants in government , local or defence authorities , ORG , the police , the prosecution , courts or diplomatic service , customs , ORG supervisory bodies and other authorities monitoring public institutions , as lawyers or notaries , as employees of banks and other credit institutions , on strategic economic projects , in security companies ( structures ) , in other companies ( structures ) providing detective services , in communications systems , or in the educational system as teachers , educators or heads of institutions [ ; ] nor may they perform a job requiring the carrying of a weapon . ”

“ ( CARDINAL ) The restrictions provided for in section CARDINAL shall not be applied to former permanent employees of the ORG who , while working at the ORG , investigated only criminal cases and who discontinued their work at the ORG not later than DATE .

( CARDINAL ) ORG into the Genocide and Resistance of the NORP People and ORG may [ recommend by ] a reasoned application that no restrictions under this law be applied to former permanent employees of the ORG who , within DATE of the entry into force of this PERSON , report to ORG and disclose all information in their possession ... about their former work at the ORG and their current relations with former ORG employees and agents . A decision in this respect shall be taken by a commission of CARDINAL persons set up by the President of the Republic . No employees of ORG into the Genocide and Resistance of the NORP People or ORG may be appointed to the commission . The commission ’s rules shall be confirmed by the President of the Republic . ”

CARDINAL . Following the examination by ORG of the compatibility of LAW with LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , on CARDINAL DATE section CARDINAL of LAW was amended to the effect that even those individuals who had worked for the ORG after CARDINAL DATE could be eligible for the exceptions under LAW .

CARDINAL . On DATE a separate law on the implementation of LAW was enacted . Under that law , ORG into the Genocide and Resistance of the NORP People and ORG were empowered to reach a conclusion on an individual ’s status as a “ former permanent employee of the ORG ” ( “ former ORG officer ” ) for the purposes of LAW .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Government adopted a list ( “ the list ” ) of positions in various branches of the ORG on NORP territory attesting to a person ’s status as a “ former ORG officer ” for the purposes of LAW . A total of CARDINAL different positions were listed in this respect .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG examined the issue of LAW compatibility with LAW . ORG held in particular that LAW had been passed in order to carry out “ security screening ” measures on former ORG officers , who were deemed to be lacking in loyalty to ORG . ORG decided that the prohibition on former ORG officers occupying public posts was compatible with LAW . It further ruled that the statutory ban on the holding by former ORG officers of jobs in various branches of the private sector was compatible with the constitutional principle of a free choice of profession in that the ORG was entitled to lay down specific requirements for persons applying for work in the most important economic sectors in order to ensure the protection of national security and proper functioning of the educational and financial systems . ORG also held that the restrictions under LAW did not amount to a criminal charge against former ORG officers .

CARDINAL . While LAW does not specifically guarantee a right of access to a court to contest the security intelligence authorities’ conclusion , it was recognised by the domestic courts that , as a matter of practice , a dismissal from employment in the public service on the basis of that conclusion gave rise to an administrative court action ( and a further appeal ) under the general procedure governing industrial disputes and alleged breaches of personal rights by the public authorities , under LAW , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and CARDINAL of LAW , LAW and LAW as in force at the material time ) .

CARDINAL . Restrictions have been imposed in many post - communist countries with a view to screening the employment of former security agents or active collaborators in the former regimes . In this connection , international human rights bodies have at times found fault with such legislation where it has lacked precision or proportionality , and have characterised it as discrimination in employment or the exercise of a profession on the basis of political opinion ( see below ) . The possibility of appealing to the courts has been considered a significant safeguard , although not sufficient in itself to rectify shortcomings in the legislation .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW provides :
“ With a view to ensuring the effective exercise of the right to work , the Parties undertake :
CARDINAL . NORP to protect effectively the right of the worker to earn his living in an occupation freely entered upon[. ] ”

This provision , retained word for word in the revised Charter of DATE ( which came into force with regard to GPE on DATE ) , has been consistently interpreted by ORG ) as establishing a right not to be discriminated against in employment . The non - discrimination guarantee is stipulated in Article E of the revised LAW in the following terms :

“ The enjoyment of the rights set forth in this LAW shall be secured without discrimination on any ground such as race , colour , sex , language , religion , political or other opinion , national extraction or social origin , health , association with a national minority , birth or other status . ”

The question of the dismissal of public servants on account of their activities under totalitarian regimes has been addressed in the light of these provisions , at least as regards GPE . In its most recent examination of GPE ’s compliance with LAW ( published in DATE ) , the ORG took note of the provisions of the reunification treaty that allow for the dismissal of public servants on the basis of their activities on behalf of the security services of GPE . It concluded that GPE was not complying with its obligations . This was expanded upon in the following terms :

“ The ORG observes that there is no precise definition of the functions from which individuals can be excluded , either in the form of a refusal to recruit or a dismissal , on the grounds of previous political activities or activities within the former GPE institutions competent in security matters .

The ORG has examined the conformity of these provisions in the light of LAW . Under this provision , restriction of a right enshrined in the LAW is permitted if it is prescribed by law , is necessary in a democratic society and serves one of the purposes listed in the LAW . Whilst recognising that the provisions were prescribed by law within the meaning of LAW of the purposes listed therein , namely the protection of national security , the ORG considered that they were not necessary within the meaning of LAW in that they did not apply solely to services which had responsibilities in the fields of law and order and national security or to functions involving such responsibilities . ”
The ORG adopted its conclusions in regard to GPE ’s implementation of the revised LAW on DATE . They will be made public at a later date .

CARDINAL . ORG ( ORG ) has also adopted a number of relevant international legal instruments . The most pertinent text is ORG no . CARDINAL on ORG ) of DATE . In its DATE ORG , ORG on ORG ( ORG ) restated its interpretation of Convention no . CARDINAL , drawing upon examples taken from national law . Regarding GPE , the ORG ’s position was the following ( § CARDINAL ) :

“ The ORG does not accept the argument that in cases in which persons had been accused of having carried out political activities in the former GPE , the more the person had , by the assumption of certain functions , identified himself or herself with that unjust regime , the more incriminated he or she was , and the less reasonable it was that this person hold a position in the current administration . ”

More recently , however , the ORG has expressed satisfaction with the NORP ORG observance of the principle of proportionality in cases where civil servants challenge their dismissal ( see paragraph CARDINAL of the Individual Observation to GPE under Convention no . CARDINAL in DATE ) .
A DATE survey identifies comparable provisions in the domestic law of a number of other GPE .

In GPE , section QUANTITY of the Preceding and Concluding Provisions of the Banks and LAW of DATE excluded persons who had served the previous regime in certain capacities from employment in banks . ORG ruled in DATE that this provision was in violation of the LAW and of ORG no . CARDINAL .

In the former GPE , the so - called LAW was passed in DATE , preventing persons who had served the previous regime in a number of capacities from taking up employment in the civil service or parts of the private sector . This legislation was declared unconstitutional by ORG in DATE , which further found it to be incompatible with Convention no . CARDINAL . However , it remained in force in GPE , while the ORG urged the NORP authorities to have due regard to the principle of proportionality in the application of the Act .
In GPE , ORG of DATE and LAW of DATE prohibit the employment of persons who worked for or with the ORG . In DATE the ORG expressed its dissatisfaction with the above texts in the following terms :

“ CARDINAL . The ORG recalls that requirements of a political nature can be set for a particular job , but to ensure that they are not contrary to the LAW , they should be limited to the characteristics of a particular post and be in proportion to its labour requirements . The ORG notes that the above - established exclusions by the provisions under examination apply broadly to the entire civil service and police rather than to specific jobs , functions or tasks . The ORG is concerned that these provisions appear to go beyond justifiable exclusions in respect of a particular job based on its inherent requirements as provided for LAW . The ORG recalls that for measures not to be deemed discriminatory under LAW , they must be measures affecting an individual on account of activities he or she is justifiably suspected or proved to be engaged in which are prejudicial to the security of the ORG . LAW does not exclude from the definition of discrimination measures taken by reason of membership of a particular group or community . ORG also notes that in cases where persons are deemed to be justifiably suspected of or engaged in activities prejudicial to the security of the ORG , the individual concerned shall have the right to appeal to a competent body in accordance with national practice .

CARDINAL . In the light of the above , the ORG considers the exclusions from being a candidate for any civil service position and from being employed by the police are not sufficiently well defined and delimited to ensure that they do not become discrimination in employment and occupation based on political opinion ... ”
